title: WCAS LATIN 201-3-20 Introduction to Latin Literature

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
The third quarter of second-year Latin combines literary analysis with mastery of grammar and syntax at the intermediate level. A grade of C- or better satisfies the WCAS language requirement.
This is mainly a workshop course, with discussion focusing on questions by members of the course. Though translation will be a component in evaluation, it will be a relatively minor criterion of success. The main topics of discussion will be how meaning and emphasis are communicated in Latin.
Though Latin 201-3 concentrates on language skills, it also develops skills of analysis that are foundational for the future study of literature in any language.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: PREREQUISITES: Successful completion of Latin 201-2, OR by placing into Latin 201-3 through the online Latin Placement Test. Students who earned a 4 on the AP Latin exam can enroll in the class without taking the Latin Placement Test. For further information, contact the Director of Latin Instruction Francesca Tataranni (f-tataranni@northwestern.edu).

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
-students will have gained mastery of Latin grammar and syntax at intermediate level;
-students will have gained or perfected their literary analysis skills;
-students will have gained a basic understanding of the cultural context of the works of literature discussed throughout the course.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Class participationDiscussionGroup workLectureDiscussion, with emphasis on student participation. Ownership of this class is entirely in the students' hands, with the instructor functioning as facilitator.
